Falcon is a planner app for aviculturists, optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI) while still having the benefits of a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
It has been designed to improve syntax friendliness.
2. Go to the folder on your local storage where the program was downloaded.
3. For the best experience, open the jar file in IntelliJ.
4. Click run and begin interacting with falcon.
5. Try some simple commands such as:
- `task t1` then `list` to see the task t1 added to your list.
- `mark 1` then `list` to see the previously created task as marked done.
6. Refer to the Features list below for more command details.
Note: All commands are case insensitive
Every deadline should have a due date.
Add an event to your planner.
View all tasks, events, and deadlines in your planner.
You need to provide the index of the task to be deleted.
This index is the position at which the task appears in your planner list.
Suggested: use list command to check the index required.
Shows a list of all commands supported by Falcon.
Mark task at index as completed. See delete command for a more thorough explanation of an index.
Mark task at index as not completed. See delete command for a more thorough explanation of an index.
Returns all tasks in the planner that contain the given keyword in their description.
This helps speed up search operation on the planner.
Note: indices shown in the returned are not the actual indices as stored in the planner. Commands that rely on indices will not work as expected.
Returns a comprehensive description of the task at the given index
Returns true if task given at index in the planner is due today.
